_metadata.context: Integrated Framework for Inquiry and Creation

concepts.name: Argument Map
concepts.scenario: Writing a policy paper on universal basic income.
concepts.theory_application: Visually map the logical structure of an argument or system, showing the relationships between claims, evidence, and conclusions.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by Evidence and a Warrant. Procedural Link: The action is to map the research logic, ensuring every Claim is supported by Evidence and a clear Warrant (logical bridge).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Toulmin Diagram of the economic argument.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum uses User Stories as the core unit of work. Procedural Link: The action is to map the feature logic, ensuring every User Story (claim) is supported by Acceptance Criteria (evidence) and a Technical Spec (warrant).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Benefit Map linking UBI to GDP growth.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to visually structure the paper, explicitly detailing the central claim, all supporting evidence, and the logical warrants (N22).
variations.specific_deliverable: An Essay Outline structuring the chapters.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to map the conceptual flow of the work, ensuring the visual elements logically support the core aesthetic intent.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Argument Map for the infographic.

variations.theory: Definition: Habermas defined 'communicative rationality'—agreement reached through reasoned dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to map the ethical dilemma, showing the conflicting moral principles and the logical justification for the chosen resolution.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Ethical Logic Tree justifying the policy.

concepts.name: Balance
concepts.theory_application: Maintain a dynamic equilibrium between opposing forces or needs to ensure the long-term health and stability of the system.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the experimental design has a balance between control, ecological validity, and replicability.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Quality Metric Dashboard tracking bug rates.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the plan has a balanced workload that aligns with the team's capacity and mitigates the risk of burnout.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Team Burnout Monitor tracking overtime.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the argument maintains a balance between attention to detail (close reading) and broad theoretical synthesis.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Scope Balance Chart managing feature creep.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to achieve visual or conceptual harmony by ensuring all aesthetic elements are in dynamic equilibrium.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Balance Check of the UI layout.

variations.theory: Definition: Meadows focuses on identifying leverage points. Procedural Link: The action is to achieve a dynamic equilibrium between the competing needs of stakeholders and the environment.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Stakeholder Balance Matrix ensuring equity.

concepts.name: Blueprint
concepts.theory_application: Create a comprehensive, authoritative document that translates the abstract vision into precise, actionable specifications for execution.

variations.theory: Definition: The blueprint must be precise, unambiguous, and complete. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the blueprint is precise, unambiguous, and complete enough that a team of strangers could build the system exactly as intended.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Structural Blueprint for the foundation.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the blueprint (Technical Spec - N25) must act as the source of truth for the entire execution team, reducing ambiguity.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Master Construction Schedule.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the blueprint (Outline) must dictate the linear flow of the written argument, ensuring logical progression.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Spatial Flow Diagram for patrons.

variations.theory: Definition: Alexander's patterns define reusable solutions and constraints. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the blueprint (Storyboard/Maquette) must be the authoritative final specification used to guide the fabrication or construction team.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Lighting Plan for reading areas.

variations.theory: Definition: RRI requires defining 'red lines'—non-negotiable ethical boundaries. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the blueprint must detail the governance structure and all decision-making flows, ensuring transparency.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Access Policy document.

concepts.name: Codification
concepts.theory_application: Translate tacit knowledge, intuition, or complex logic into explicit, written rules or protocols that can be followed by others.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to translate the intellectual logic of the hypothesis into the formal, rule-based syntax of the experimental protocol.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Standard Operating Procedure for the lab.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to translate the abstract design concept into explicit, measurable user stories and acceptance criteria.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Process Manual for the team.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to translate the initial interpretive insight into a formal, structured theoretical language.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Theoretical Definition of the method.

variations.theory: Definition: Alexander's patterns define reusable solutions and constraints. Procedural Link: The action is to translate an ephemeral artistic idea into a durable, written form (e.g., a score, instructions, a pattern).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Training Video Script demonstrating the technique.

variations.theory: Definition: Bakhtin's theory emphasizes that meaning is created through dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to translate tacit cultural integrated knowledge or a successful process into a repeatable ritual sequence (N88) or formal principle.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Knowledge Transfer Guide for future staff.

concepts.name: Design System
concepts.scenario: Creating a digital platform for a government agency.
concepts.theory_application: Create a collection of reusable components, standards, and guidelines that ensure consistency, efficiency, and quality across a complex system.

variations.theory: Definition: Tufte emphasizes maximizing the data-ink ratio and visual clarity. Procedural Link: The action is to create a framework for standardizing data visualization components to ensure clarity and honesty across all reports.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Data Chart Library for consistency.

variations.theory: Definition: Atomic Design builds interfaces from reusable components. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the Design System must be built using 'Atomic Design' principles, ensuring components are reusable and consistent.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Atomic Component Library (buttons, forms).

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to create a formal style guide or templated language to ensure the consistency and accessibility of all scholarly communication.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Content Style Guide for plain language.

variations.theory: Definition: Alexander's patterns define reusable solutions and constraints. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the Design System must be a 'kit of parts' that allows for both consistency and creative freedom.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Pattern Library for page layouts.

variations.theory: Definition: RRI requires defining 'red lines'—non-negotiable ethical boundaries. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the Design System must include ethical tokens (e.g., a specific color for 'risk') to ensure ethical considerations are visually present in all designs.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Accessibility Standard for diverse users.

concepts.name: End-to-End Tracer
concepts.scenario: Building a new e-commerce checkout flow.
concepts.theory_application: Build a minimal, functional thread that connects all system components from start to finish, proving integration before adding detail.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to build the minimal working system that proves the critical sensor, data pipeline, and analysis module are integrated and functional.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Transaction Test Script verifying payment.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to build a 'Walking Skeleton'—the thinnest possible version of a complete feature that proves the architecture works before functionality is added.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Hello World Checkout app (no UI).

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to outline the argument from the introduction to the conclusion, ensuring a clear and continuous logical flow.
variations.specific_deliverable: A User Flow Diagram from cart to receipt.
variations.rubric: Outline argument from intro to conclusion.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to create a simple, connected prototype of the entire user journey or narrative arc.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Clickable Wireframe of the happy path.

variations.theory: Definition: Meadows focuses on identifying feedback loops. Procedural Link: The action is to map the complete flow of communication or accountability across all roles and systems.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Data Privacy Audit of the transaction flow.

concepts.name: Flowchart
concepts.theory_application: Create a visual representation of a process or system, showing the sequence of steps, decision points, and relationships between components.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to use a flowchart to illustrate the sequence of experimental steps, decision points, and conditional logic.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Decision Tree for ticket routing.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to use a flowchart to visualize the user flow or the system logic (state chart).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Service Blueprint of the support lifecycle.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to use a flowchart to visualize the logical sequence of ideas in a paper (Argument Map - N22) or the decision process in a legal brief.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Script Flowchart for agent responses.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to use a flowchart to map the required sequence of movements, cuts, or technical steps.
variations.specific_deliverable: A UX Flow Diagram for the help center.

variations.theory: Definition: Meadows focuses on identifying feedback loops. Procedural Link: The action is to use a flowchart to diagram a social ritual (N88) or a conflict resolution process.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Escalation Protocol for angry customers.

concepts.name: Harmony
concepts.theory_application: Ensure that all elements of a system or composition relate to each other in a consistent, balanced, and mutually reinforcing way.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the experimental procedure is internally consistent and aligns perfectly with the stated hypothesis.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Message Consistency Check across channels.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure all components of the plan (code, design, content) are aligned and work together without unnecessary friction.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Campaign Timeline aligning email and social.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure all evidence and interpretations align to support the central thesis without contradiction.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Brand Voice Audit ensuring tone consistency.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to achieve visual or conceptual harmony by ensuring all aesthetic elements are in dynamic equilibrium.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Identity Review of all assets.

variations.theory: Definition: Bakhtin's theory emphasizes that meaning is created through dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to achieve a dynamic equilibrium between the competing needs of stakeholders and the environment.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Stakeholder Alignment Report.

concepts.name: Heuristics

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to provide simple, reusable rules (e.g., 'always use RICE scoring,' 'keep components modular') to accelerate decision-making.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to provide templates or frameworks (e.g., Claim-Evidence-Warrant) to structure logical arguments.

variations.theory: Definition: SCAMPER is a checklist for systematic variation. Procedural Link: The action is to provide the SCAMPER checklist or other creative constraint patterns to generate ideas.

variations.theory: Definition: RRI requires defining 'red lines'—non-negotiable ethical boundaries. Procedural Link: The action is to codify principles of justice or care to guide ethical action (e.g., 'do no harm').
variations.specific_deliverable: An Ethical Decision Guide for conflicts.

concepts.theory_application: Verify that the structure, sequence, and reasoning of a system or argument are sound, consistent, and free from contradictions.

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the experimental procedure must follow a sound, consistent, and rational sequence to ensure the results are valid.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Formula Audit Log checking calculations.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the project plan must be internally consistent and the tasks flow sequentially without contradiction.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Logic Flow Review of the spreadsheet.

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the argument must follow the strict principles of validity and soundness (N22).
variations.specific_deliverable: An Assumption Check of the forecast.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the internal, consistent system of rules that governs a final artistic composition or design layout.

variations.theory: Definition: Habermas defined 'communicative rationality'—agreement reached through reasoned dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to ensure the consistency and fairness of the justification for an ethical decision.

concepts.name: Oral Tradition

variations.theory: Definition: The scientific method requires intellectual honesty. Procedural Link: The action is to transmit unwritten technical know-how (e.g., specific instrument calibration tricks) through verbal apprenticeship or direct mentorship.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to pass on successful processes and tacit knowledge through training, storytelling, and direct coaching.

variations.theory: Definition: Bakhtin's theory emphasizes that meaning is created through dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to structure arguments around narrative elements and using public speaking to engage in scholarly debate.

variations.theory: Definition: Graham's work sought to find the physical expression for the inner emotional landscape. Procedural Link: The action is to use narrative and performative techniques to organize and transfer knowledge (e.g., a musical score, a play script).

variations.theory: Definition: Bakhtin's theory emphasizes that meaning is created through dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to use narrative structuring (N93) and Teaching Stories (N91) to codify integrated knowledge and communal history.

concepts.name: Order
concepts.theory_application: Impose a structured arrangement or sequence on elements to create stability, predictability, and efficiency.

variations.specific_deliverable: A Sorting Protocol for inventory.

variations.theory: Definition: Scrum requires 'commitment' from the entire team. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the overall workflow and backlog to reduce chaos and maximize predictability.
variations.specific_deliverable: A 5S Implementation Plan (Sort, Set, Shine...).

variations.theory: Definition: Toulmin's model requires a Claim to be supported by evidence. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the flow of the paper so that the reader is led logically from premise to conclusion.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Logistics Flow Map from dock to shelf.

variations.theory: Definition: Arnheim analyzes the psychology of visual perception. Procedural Link: The action is to achieve a harmonious arrangement of visual or conceptual elements in the final work.

variations.theory: Definition: Habermas defined 'communicative rationality'—agreement reached through reasoned dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to establish a transparent social order that minimizes conflict and maximizes collective well-being.

concepts.name: Outline
concepts.theory_application: Create a hierarchical or sequential framework that organizes the main points and supporting details of a work before full execution.

variations.theory: Definition: The outline is the hierarchical structure of the argument. Procedural Link: The action is to create a hierarchical structure of the argument, detailing the major sections, sub-sections, and the logical flow of the research paper.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Proposal Outline detailing the hypothesis.

variations.theory: Definition: The outline is the hierarchical organization of tasks. Procedural Link: The action is to create a hierarchical organization of tasks (Work Breakdown Structure - N24) or the narrative spine of the user journey.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Work Breakdown Structure for the grant.

variations.theory: Definition: The outline is the linear structure of the written work. Procedural Link: The action is to create a detailed list of headings and key claims for each paragraph, ensuring the linear structure supports the central thesis.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Narrative Arc for the impact statement.

variations.theory: Definition: The outline is a sequential plan for a creative project. Procedural Link: The action is to create a sequential plan for a creative project, focusing on narrative arc and major visual beats.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Visual Storyboard for the presentation.

variations.theory: Definition: The outline is a sequenced list of steps for a workshop or dialogue. Procedural Link: The action is to create a sequenced list of steps for a workshop or community dialogue to ensure a logical progression of conversation.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Stakeholder Engagement Plan.

concepts.name: Pattern Language
concepts.theory_application: Identify and codify recurring problems and their solutions into a shared vocabulary or library that can be reused and adapted.

variations.theory: Definition: A pattern language is a reusable template for solutions. Procedural Link: The action is to create a reusable template for experimental protocols or data visualization standards that can be applied across different research problems.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Standard Detail Library for insulation.

variations.theory: Definition: A pattern language is a shared repository of repeatable solutions. Procedural Link: The action is to create a shared repository of repeatable solutions to common design or development challenges.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Unit Layout Catalog for efficiency.

variations.theory: Definition: A pattern language is a methodology guide. Procedural Link: The action is to create a methodology guide that describes repeatable approaches to structural analysis or critique.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Community Design Guide for shared spaces.

variations.theory: Definition: A pattern language is a formalized catalog of aesthetic problems and tested solutions. Procedural Link: The action is to create a formalized catalog of aesthetic problems and tested solutions (e.g., 'How to organize 5 elements in a space').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Pattern Language Book for the village.

variations.theory: Definition: A pattern language is a codified set of social solutions. Procedural Link: The action is to codify social solutions and governance structures into a language that can be widely adopted (N142).

concepts.name: Protocol

variations.theory: Definition: The protocol is a formalized, explicit process. Procedural Link: The action is to create a formalized, explicit process for tasks like code review, incident response, or deployment.

variations.theory: Definition: The RACI matrix is a tool for managing dependencies. Procedural Link: The action is to create a chart for managing dependencies and clarity in cross-functional teams, ensuring no task lacks an owner.

variations.theory: Definition: The RACI matrix maps roles and decision rights. Procedural Link: The action is to create a map detailing the roles and decision rights of co-authors, collaborators, and ethical review boards.

variations.theory: Definition: The RACI matrix defines roles in a complex project. Procedural Link: The action is to create a chart defining the roles of designers, fabricators, and production managers in a complex project.

variations.theory: Definition: The RACI matrix clarifies decision rights. Procedural Link: The action is to create a diagram clarifying the decision rights of the governance body and the implementing team.

concepts.theory_application: Define the entity of study as a set of interacting or interdependent component parts forming a complex/intricate whole.

variations.theory: Definition: The system is the defined entity of study. Procedural Link: The action is to define the entity of study (e.g., a reactor, a biological pathway) or the entire hardware/software environment of the lab.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Network Topology Map.

variations.theory: Definition: The system is the entire product or workflow. Procedural Link: The action is to define the entire product, the organization, or the specific workflow being optimized.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Route Optimization Model.

variations.theory: Definition: The system is the historical, political, or cultural context. Procedural Link: The action is to define the historical, political, or cultural context being analyzed (e.g., the 'patriarchal system,' the 'modern university').
variations.specific_deliverable: A Service Access Map by neighborhood.

variations.theory: Definition: The system is the complete artistic creation. Procedural Link: The action is to define the complete artistic creation, including all its interconnected, interdependent parts.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Wayfinding System Design.

variations.theory: Definition: The system is the stakeholder ecosystem. Procedural Link: The action is to define the stakeholder ecosystem of human, natural, and institutional actors.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Rider Demographic Analysis.

concepts.name: Technical Specification
concepts.theory_application: Create a detailed document that defines the technical requirements, standards, and constraints for a product or system.

variations.theory: Definition: The specification details technical requirements. Procedural Link: The action is to create a formal document detailing all technical requirements, tolerances, and interface definitions for an engineered solution (N25).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Structural Load Spec.

variations.theory: Definition: The specification details software requirements and data contracts. Procedural Link: The action is to create the detailed documentation of software requirements, API contracts, and user acceptance criteria (N25).
variations.specific_deliverable: A Sensor Integration Spec.

variations.expert: The Belmont Report - The Safety Officer
variations.theory: Definition: The specification details research methodology and data handling. Procedural Link: The action is to create a document detailing the research methodology, data handling procedures, and archival practices.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Safety Inspection Protocol.

variations.theory: Definition: The specification details materials, color codes, and production resolutions. Procedural Link: The action is to create a design spec detailing materials, color codes, and print resolutions for final production.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Material Finish Spec.

variations.theory: Definition: The specification details technical safeguards. Procedural Link: The action is to create a document detailing the technical safeguards required to meet the ethical mandate (e.g., data encryption requirements).
variations.specific_deliverable: An Environmental Impact Spec.

concepts.name: User Story Map
concepts.theory_application: Create a visual map that arranges user stories into a narrative flow, helping to prioritize features and understand the user experience.

variations.theory: Definition: The User Story Map is a visual tool for sequencing tasks. Procedural Link: The action is to use a visual tool for sequencing research tasks based on the narrative of a scientist's workflow.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Booking Flow Map.

variations.theory: Definition: The User Story Map is a visual backlog organized along a narrative backbone. Procedural Link: The action is to create a visual backlog organized along a narrative backbone of the user's journey, prioritized to deliver minimal end-to-end experiences.
variations.specific_deliverable: A User Story Map for the MVP.

variations.theory: Definition: The User Story Map is a visual roadmap. Procedural Link: The action is to create a historical timeline or conceptual roadmap organized by the major claims a scholar must establish.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Feature Release Plan.

variations.theory: Definition: The User Story Map is a detailed storyboard. Procedural Link: The action is to create a detailed storyboard that captures the viewer's emotional journey through the experience.
variations.specific_deliverable: A UX Storyboard of the trip.

variations.theory: Definition: The User Story Map is a map of the sequence of community interactions. Procedural Link: The action is to create a map of the sequence of community interactions required to achieve a shared goal.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Service Ecosystem Map.

concepts.name: Narrative Arc
concepts.scenario: Structuring a pitch deck or a user journey.
concepts.theory_application: Organize the components of the plan into a dramatic sequence (Beginning, Middle, End) to maximize engagement and coherence.

variations.theory: Definition: ABT (And, But, Therefore) is the DNA of story. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the abstract as: Context (And), Problem (But), Solution (Therefore).
variations.specific_deliverable: An ABT Abstract.

variations.theory: Definition: The Sparkline moves between 'What is' and 'What could be'. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the presentation to oscillate between the status quo and the vision.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Sparkline Diagram.
variations.rubric: Oscillates between status quo and vision.

variations.theory: Definition: Metahistory analyzes the plot structure of historical accounts. Procedural Link: The action is to consciously choose the plot mode (e.g., Tragedy, Comedy) that best fits the argument.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Plot Mode Selection.

variations.theory: Definition: Poetics defines the arc of reversal and recognition. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the experience to lead to a moment of catharsis.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Catharsis Map.

variations.theory: Definition: Public Narrative (Story of Self, Us, Now). Procedural Link: The action is to structure the campaign to link personal motivation to collective identity and urgent action.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Public Narrative Script.

concepts.name: Dependency Mapping
concepts.theory_application: Identify the logical relationships between tasks to determine the sequence in which they must be performed.

variations.theory: Definition: Program Evaluation and Review Technique. Procedural Link: The action is to identify the sequence of chemical reactions where step B cannot start until step A yields a specific purity.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Reaction Sequence Chart.

variations.theory: Definition: Critical Chain Project Management. Procedural Link: The action is to identify the chain of tasks that determines the project's duration and protect it with buffers.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Critical Chain Buffer.

variations.theory: Definition: Premise dependency. Procedural Link: The action is to map which claims must be proven true before the subsequent claims can be accepted.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Premise Dependency Tree.

variations.theory: Definition: Load-bearing logic. Procedural Link: The action is to determine which structural elements must be in place to support the aesthetic skin.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Load-Bearing Diagram.

variations.theory: Definition: Theory of Change. Procedural Link: The action is to map the preconditions (e.g., trust) that must exist before a specific intervention (e.g., voting) can succeed.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Precondition Map.

concepts.name: Modularity
concepts.theory_application: Decompose a system into distinct, independent parts that can be created, tested, and replaced individually.

variations.theory: Definition: Near-decomposability allows complex systems to evolve. Procedural Link: The action is to isolate variables so that a change in one sub-system does not crash the whole experiment.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Variable Isolation Plan.

variations.theory: Definition: Loose coupling, high cohesion. Procedural Link: The action is to define clear API boundaries between teams so they can deploy independently.
variations.specific_deliverable: An API Contract.

variations.theory: Definition: Knowledge can be chunked into discrete articles. Procedural Link: The action is to structure the work as a collection of independent essays that can be read in any order.
variations.specific_deliverable: An Anthology Structure.

variations.theory: Definition: Atomic Design (Atoms, Molecules, Organisms). Procedural Link: The action is to design the smallest visual elements first (buttons) and combine them into complex structures (pages).
variations.specific_deliverable: An Atomic Component Library.

variations.theory: Definition: Autonomous Circles. Procedural Link: The action is to define semi-autonomous working groups with clear domains of authority.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Circle Constitution.

concepts.name: Lesson Frameworks

variations.theory: PPP (Presentation, Practice, Production). Procedural Link: Structure the lesson to move from teacher input to student output.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Staged Lesson Plan.

concepts.theory_application: Use a proven structural template to organize the flow of learning.

concepts.name: Process Blades

variations.theory: Enterprise agility requires modular governance. Procedural Link: Define the specific 'blade' (e.g., Finance, IT) and its interface with the agile teams.
variations.specific_deliverable: A Process Blade Diagram.

concepts.theory_application: Define modular governance structures for different organizational capabilities.

concepts.name: WBS Dictionary

variations.theory: Definition: Scope Baseline. Link: Detail the boundaries of every task.
variations.specific_deliverable: WBS Dictionary Entry

concepts.scenario: Providing absolute clarity on what is (and isn't) included in a specific work package.
concepts.theory_application: Create a formal document describing every component in the Work Breakdown Structure to prevent scope creep.
